description: Simple SELECT query with single parameter
code:
<q:query name="user" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = :id
    <q:param name="id" value="123" type="integer" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Executes SELECT query with integer parameter binding, returns user with id=123
use_case: Fetching a single record by primary key

description: Basic SELECT query with string parameter
code:
<q:query name="products" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT * FROM products WHERE name = :product_name
    <q:param name="product_name" value="Laptop" type="string" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Executes SELECT query with string parameter binding, returns products named 'Laptop'

code:
<q:query name="insertUser" datasource="app-db">
    INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (:name, :email)
    <q:param name="name" value="John Doe" type="string" />
    <q:param name="email" value="john@example.com" type="string" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Inserts new user record with name and email
use_case: Creating new records without needing the inserted data back

description: Basic UPDATE query with WHERE clause
code:
<q:query name="updatePrice" datasource="app-db">
    UPDATE products SET price = :new_price WHERE id = :product_id
    <q:param name="new_price" value="99.99" type="decimal" />
    <q:param name="product_id" value="5" type="integer" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Updates price for product with id=5 to 99.99

code:
<q:query name="deleteUser" datasource="app-db">
    DELETE FROM users WHERE id = :user_id
    <q:param name="user_id" value="42" type="integer" />
</q:query>

description: SELECT query with ORDER BY clause
code:
<q:query name="sortedProducts" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY price DESC
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Returns all products sorted by price in descending order

code:
<q:query name="topUsers" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 10
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Returns first 10 users from the database
use_case: Limiting query results for pagination or performance

code:
<q:query name="newUser" datasource="app-db">
    INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (:name, :email) RETURNING id
    <q:param name="name" value="Jane Smith" type="string" />
    <q:param name="email" value="jane@example.com" type="string" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Inserts user and returns the generated id
use_case: Getting auto-generated primary key after insert

code:
<q:query name="pendingOrders" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT * FROM orders WHERE user_id = :uid AND status = :status
    <q:param name="uid" value="100" type="integer" />
    <q:param name="status" value="pending" type="string" />
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Returns pending orders for user with id=100

code:
<q:query name="userCount" datasource="app-db">
    SELECT COUNT(*) as total FROM users
</q:query>
expected_behavior: Returns total count of users in the database
